definition: to make a long story short (idiom)
length/long/forever/always/constantly
chief/head/elder/to grow/to develop/to increase/to enhance
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
old variant of 話|话[hua4]
short/brief/to lack/weak point/fault
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
variant of 說|说[shuo1]

sentences.english: You dad just beeped in, but can you make it quick?
sentences.chinese: 你爸爸打电话来了，你能长话短说吗？

sentences.english: The manager asked me to be brief.
And a long story short, we never build our secure E-mail program.
sentences.chinese: 长话短说，我们从没建立过电子邮件安全系统。

sentences.english: Which begs the question, what does it take to become a popular president?
sentences.chinese: 长话短说，怎样做才能成为一名有民望的总统？

sentences.english: It’s a long story, but put it in a nutshell, he got killed by another bad guy.
sentences.chinese: 说来话长，不过长话短说，他被另一个坏蛋干掉了。

sentences.english: Long story short, she was hitting on me all night and acting like a complete skank.
sentences.chinese: 长话短说，她整晚都在和我搭讪，这让人感觉恶心。

sentences.english: Long story short, now Marla's out to ruin another part of my life.
sentences.chinese: 长话短说，现在马拉又毁掉我生活的一部分。

sentences.english: I want to make it short.
To cut a long story short, we`ve decided to create a new post.
sentences.chinese: 长话短说，我们决定增设一个新的岗位。

definition: start explaining and it's a long story (idiom); complicated and not easy to express succinctly
lit. to open the door and see the mountain; fig. to get right to the point (idiom)
to return to the topic (idiom)/to get back to the main point
not to mince words/not to beat about the bush
pinyin: da3 kai1 tian1 chuang1 shuo1 liang4 hua4

definition: to stop at this point/to end here/to call it a day
incorrect variant of 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
lit. to go on a long detour/fig. to speak vaguely around the topic without getting to the point/to beat about the bush
concise and comprehensive (idiom)
the matter should not be delayed/there's no time to lose
to keep listeners in suspense (in storytelling)/to keep people on tenterhooks
nonsense/rubbish/superfluous words/You don't say!/No kidding! (gently sarcastic)
to stop/to halt
to say sth
to set off/to take to the road
variant of 少安毋躁[shao3 an1 wu2 zao4]
long-winded/wordy/troublesome/pesky/also pr. [luo1 suo1]
